books.author: Michelle Alexander
books.description: A law professor on the “war on drugs” and its role in the disproportionate incarceration of Black men. Read by Karen Chilton. 16 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE NEW JIM CROW

books.author: Layla F Saad
books.description: Ways to understand and possibly counteract white privilege. Read by the author. 5 hours, 19 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ME AND WHITE SUPREMACY

books.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
books.description: A meditation on race in America as well as a personal story, framed as a letter to the author's teenage son. Read by the author. 3 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BETWEEN THE WORLD AND ME

books.author: Ijeoma Oluo
books.description: A look at the contemporary racial landscape of the United States. Read by Bahni Turpin. 7 hours, 41 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT RACE

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Austin Channing Brown
books.description: A Black woman who was given a white man's name by her parents shares her journey to finding her own worth and what stands in the way of racial justice. Read by the author. 3 hours, 54 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M STILL HERE

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Ibram X Kendi
books.description: A look at anti-Black racist ideas and their effect on the course of American history. Read by Christopher Dontrell Piper. 19 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: STAMPED FROM THE BEGINNING

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts. Read by the author. 8 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: Bryan Stevenson
books.description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death. Read by the author. 11 hours, 11 minutes unabridged.
books.title: JUST MERCY

books.author: Dinesh D'Souza
books.description: The conservative commentator makes his case that identity politics are woven into what he considers socialism in America. Read by the author. 10 hours, 4 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNITED STATES OF SOCIALISM

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Jerry Craft
books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.
books.title: NEW KID

books.author: Nathan W Pyle
books.description: A sequel to “Strange Planet” that explores the subjects of traditions, nature, emotions and knowledge.
books.title: STRANGER PLANET

books.author: Raina Telgemeier
books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
books.title: GUTS
